intro: Raphanus acanthiformis, commonly known as the spiny radish, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a robust, hairy stem and pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces round, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
